intro: Chamaecrista pennellii, commonly known as the sicklepod or yellow top, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Chamaecrista pennellii is also considered an invasive species in some regions due to its aggressive spreading habit.
